citation.article-title: Alicyclobacilli from an unexplored geothermal soil in Antarctica: Mount Rittmann.

p.s: Description of Alicyclobacillus acidocaldarius subsp. rittmannii subsp. nov.
Alicyclobacillus acidocaldarius subsp. rittmannii (ritt.mann'ii M.L gen. nov. of proper name Rittmann)
Aerobic, gram-positive, non-motile spore- forming rods 0.5-2.0 μm in diameter and 2.0-4.0 μm long that occur in pairs, singly or as long chains.
Colonies are cream, opaque, convex, circular with an entire margin and 0.8-1.0 μm in diameter after 3 days of incubation.
The temperature range for growth is between 45 and 70°C with an optimum at 63°C.
The pH range for growth is 2.5-5.0 with the optimum at pH 4.0.
Indole, oxidase, catalase, urease are all negative.
Starch, gelatin, hyppurate hydro- lysis and tyrosine decomposition negative.
Growth occurred on maltose and mannose.
Sensitive to AMP- 25, C-10, FD-10, CN-30, TE-50 and VA-30.
ω-Cyclohexyl FAMEs and iso-series are the predominant fatty acids.
16S rDNA similarity data indicate a relationship with A. acidocaldarius DSM 446 of 99.1% while the DNA/DNA homology is 69.7%.
The type strain MR1 has been deposited in Deutsche Sammlung von Mikrooganismen Collection, Braunschweig, Germany (DSM 11297).
